ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: the ability to give and receive detailed, thoughtful feedback on each other's human rights capstone projects; a nuanced understanding of the critiques and potentials of human rights

This course helped me deepen my knowledge of human rights. During the first half of the course we spent each week discussing readings on pressing topics in human rights. The second half of the course focused on workshopping each capstone project. I benefitted as much if not more from hearing about my classmates' work during these 40 minute workshopping sessions than completing my own capstone project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Jim and Paul facilitated an incredibly warm and open class environment, and my fellow cohort members were extremely encouraging and supportive throughout the semester. The feedback sessions were undoubtedly the strength of the course, because they allowed us to discuss each project in detail and allot 40 minutes of our time and energy to each capstone. Weakness: More clarity regarding capstone deadlines would have been helpful. Class would sometimes go way over time, so a clearer agenda/structure for each class session would have helped us to stay on track better.

Strengths: I appreciated the supportive environment that the capstone leaders cultivated in the seminar room. The capstone leaders gave very thorough feedback on my initial idea and capstone prospectus. My classmates were thoughtful in their comments and generous in their feedback.

Weaknesses: I did not receive feedback from the capstone leaders on the first draft of my project other than a few comments at the end of my workshopping session. The class also consistently went over the scheduled end time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: The capstone seminar is a great way for human rights scholars to finish the program. Take advantage of the early first deadline--if you manage to get a solid draft down you'll thank yourself later.
